sm::eod::io::SerialPort

SerialPort Class Reference

#include <serialport.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

A simple SerialPort class supporting raw I/O and also a simple transport layer protocol for reliable transmission.

The hardware protocol is fixed to: No flow control, no parity, 8 data bits, 1 stop bit Multiple SerialPort objects can use the same COM port, but only 1 object may have the port open.

Note:
Uses the OS dependent type "BaudRate".

Attempting to open non-existing com-ports will throw a SerialPortError exception.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

SerialPort ( ComPortID  port_id = COM1,
BaudRate  rate = B9600,
bool  open = true,
BYTE  parity = NoParity,
BYTE  stop_bits = OneStopBit 
)

Constructs using the port_id, the baud-rate rate and the parity parity.

If open = true, attempts to open the serial port.

Precondition:
port_id is in the range 0..NUMPORTS

parity is in the range NOPARITY..SPACEPARITY

stop_bits is in the range ONESTOPBIT..TWOSOPBITS

Exceptions:
SerialPortError if open = true, and the port failed to open.

virtual ~SerialPort (  )  [virtual]

Closes the port before deletion.

Returns:

void open ( bool  rx_timeout = false,
int  rx_timeout_ms = RX_TIMEOUT_MS 
)

Attempts to open the serial port.

Calls openNoThrow and maps system errors to SerialPortError exception.

Parameters:
rx_timeout If true, enables SerialPort::read() timeouts.
rx_timeout_ms Number of milliseconds to block when rx_timeout == true
Exceptions:
SerialPortError if: port already open, no port or port could not support baud rate, or an operating system error occured.
See also:
SerialPort::read()

system_error_t openNoThrow ( bool  rx_timeout = false,
int  rx_timeout_ms = RX_TIMEOUT_MS 
)

Attempts to open the serial port.

Parameters:
rx_timeout If true, enables SerialPort::read() timeouts.
rx_timeout_ms Number of milliseconds to block when rx_timeout == true
Returns:
system error code if serial port failed to open. The rx_timeout parameter must be false for non-windows systems as the timeout code is not implemented yet.

ComPortID portId (  )  const

Returns:
The port id used by the object

std::string portName (  )  const

Returns:
The name-string of the port used by the object eg: "COM1", "COM2" etc

char read (  )  const

Read a single byte, blocking the calling thread until the byte is received or a timeout occurs.

Returns:
The next character read from the serial-port hardware buffer
Exceptions:
SerialPortError with SerialPortError::timeout() == true if port is opended with the rx_timeout flag set to true and the time-period between the arrival of any two characters exceeds 2 seconds or the total time exceeds rx_timeout_ms + 100ms * num_to_read.
Precondition:
isOpen() is true
See also:
open()

void read ( std::vector< uint8 > &  data,
int  num_to_read,
bool  append = false 
) const

Performs a blocking read until a specified number of bytes have been read or a timeout occurs.

Parameters:
data Received bytes are placed into this vector
num_to_read The number of bytes that are received into data before the function returns.
append If true, appends data with the received bytes, otherwise clears data before reading.
Exceptions:
SerialPortError with SerialPortError::timeout() == true if port is opended with the rx_timeout flag set to true and the time-period between the arrival of any two characters exceeds 2 seconds or the total time exceeds rx_timeout_ms + 100ms * num_to_read.
Precondition:
isOpen() is true

system_error_t readNoThrow ( std::vector< uint8 > &  data,
int  num_to_read,
bool  append 
) const

Performs a block reading of a single byte.

Does not throw.

Parameters:
data Result of read if successfull.
num_to_read 
append When true, read data will be append
Returns:
0 on success, otherwise system error number. When SerialPortError::timeout() == true and the port is opended with the rx_timeout flag set to true and the time-period between the arrival of any two characters exceeds 2 seconds or the total time exceeds rx_timeout_ms + 100ms * num_to_read then the isTimeout() function will return true when passed the return value.
Precondition:
isOpen() is true.

system_error_t readNoThrow ( uint8 &  value_out  )  const

Performs a block reading of a single byte.

Does not throw.

Parameters:
value_out Result of read if successfull.
Returns:
0 on success, otherwise system error number. When SerialPortError::timeout() == true and the port is opended with the rx_timeout flag set to true and the time-period between the arrival of any two characters exceeds 2 seconds or the total time exceeds rx_timeout_ms + 100ms * num_to_read then the isTimeout() function will return true when passed the return value.
Precondition:
isOpen() is true.

int receiveDatagram ( std::vector< uint8 > &  data,
bool  append = false 
) const

Receives a datagram over the serial-port.

Parameters:
data Data from frame is read into this vector
append If true, existing bytes in data vector are unchanged, otherwise old bytes are cleared.
Returns:
The number of bytes read.
Exceptions:
SerialPortError with SerialPortError::timeout() == true if port is opended with the rx_timeout flag set to true and the time-period between the arrival of any two characters exceeds 2 seconds or the total time exceeds rx_timeout_ms + 100ms * num_to_read.
Precondition:
isOpen() is true.
See also:
read()

CoreData Serial Protocol

system_error_t receiveDatagramNoThrow ( std::vector< uint8 > &  data,
bool  append,
int &  data_size_out 
) const

Receives a datagram over the serial-port.

Does not throw.

Parameters:
data Data from frame is read into this vector
append If true, existing bytes in data vector are unchanged, otherwise old bytes are cleared.
data_size_out The number of data bytes appended to data
Returns:
0 on success, otherwise system error number. When SerialPortError::timeout() == true and the port is opended with the rx_timeout flag set to true and the time-period between the arrival of any two characters exceeds 2 seconds or the total time exceeds rx_timeout_ms + 100ms * num_to_read then the isTimeout() function will return true when passed the return value.
Precondition:
isOpen() is true.
See also:

CoreData Serial Protocol

void reset (  ) 

Resets the serial-port.

Clears any errors and discards any bytes in the input and output buffers.

Precondition:
isOpen() is true

void sendDatagram ( const std::vector< uint8 > &  data  )  const

Constructs a datagram frame from a buffer of data and writes it to the serial port.

Parameters:
data The data to send.
Returns:
0 on success, otherwise system error number.
Exceptions:
SerialPortError with SerialPortError::timeout() == true if the time to send the data exceeds 500ms + 1ms * data.size().
Precondition:
isOpen() is true.
See also:
write()

Performs a blocking write.

Parameters:
data The data to send.
Exceptions:
SerialPortError with SerialPortError::timeout() == true if the time to send the data exceeds 500ms + 1ms * data.size().
Precondition:
isOpen() is true
See also:
open()

system_error_t writeNoThrow ( const std::vector< uint8 > &  data  )  const

Performs a blocking write.

Does not throw.

Parameters:
data The data to send.
Returns:
0 if read successful and data has been updated, otherwise system error number. If the time to send the data exceeds 500ms + 1ms * data.size() then passing the returned error number to isTimeout() will return true.
Precondition:
isOpen() is true.
